image.altText: An older man in a suit carries a book of papers as he approaches a podium, looking serious.

props.synopsis: Canada's move to join France and the United Kingdom by signalling it will recognise a Palestinian state reveals more about the highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza that now involves both Western and Arab nations.

title.children: A highly coordinated international strategy on Gaza is now unfolding

image.altText: A composite image of Dean Winter looking serious and David O'Byrne looking happy

props.synopsis: More seats have been confirmed as vote counting continues following the Tasmanian state election. Former Labor leader, now independent David O'Byrne has finished ahead of current leader Dean Winter, and Liberals Simon Behrakis and Nic Street have lost their seats.

title.children: Former Labor leader finishes ahead of current leader in Tasmanian election

image.altText: Primary school children using pencils in class

props.synopsis: Artarmon man David James was charged by Australian Federal Police with more than a dozen offences, including 10 counts of using a child under the age of 14 to make child abuse material.

title.children: Alleged paedophile worked at 58 out-of-school-hours care centres in Sydney

image.altText: Waves crash into a sea wall off a beach dotted with palm trees

props.synopsis: It was one of the strongest tremors in recorded history, but Wednesday's megathrust earthquake brought less tsunami damage than feared. Here are some factors that may have been at play.

title.children: Why Russia's 'megathrust' earthquake didn't cause a bigger tsunami

image.altText: A man stands in the foreground with a picture of another man on a screen in the background.

props.synopsis: Police believe the missing remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story have been found by a member of the public, but say testing will be undertaken to confirm. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: SA Police believe missing remains of Julian Story have been found

image.altText: man wearing glasses blue suit and red tie speaking in court close up

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke has confirmed he had dinner with FBI director Kash Patel in Sydney, with the minister saying he "enjoyed" his evening meeting with the Trump appointee. Follow live.

title.children: FBI director Kash Patel met with Tony Burke during secretive visit to Australia

image.altText: A headshot of Harris looking very disappointed.

props.synopsis: The former US vice president says she will not run for California governor next year, leaving open the possibility that she could mount a third run for the White House in 2028.

title.children: Kamala Harris says she will not run for California governor in 2026

image.altText: Brunswick Heads pod village

props.synopsis: The NSW government is making 58 pods originally set up to house people displaced by floods in the Byron Shire available for key workers in need of accommodation.

title.children: Teachers, police to be offered pod houses built for NSW flood survivors

image.altText: A blonde woman looking at the camera in a denim jacket

props.synopsis: Actor Sydney Sweeney's "good jeans" advertisement has sparked a debate about beauty standards and race.

title.children: Why an ad about Sydney Sweeney's 'great jeans' is facing backlash

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: A coroner finds no clear cause of death for 53-year-old Rachael Dixon, who died at a wellness retreat in regional Victoria.

title.children: Coroner finds woman died 'in the context' of taking magic mushrooms

image.altText: A large stick insect amongst green leaves

props.synopsis: Naturalists make the discovery in the misty rainforests of Far North Queensland, where tree canopies reach more than 30 metres above the ground and many species are believed to still be unknown.

title.children: Newly discovered giant stick insect could be Australia's heaviest

image.altText: a road in desert terrain with cars on the side of the road like a search party

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police have covered 500 square kilometres of Central Australian desert terrain in search for a man who has been missing since Monday.

title.children: Police cover 500sqm of outback terrain in search for missing 26yo man

image.altText: Rebels bikies ride their motorcycles along Scarborough Beach Road.

props.synopsis: Specialist police prepare for a Rebels Motorcycle Club run to Melbourne this weekend, before tougher laws banning the display of club colours and insignia come into force.

title.children: Rebels to ride through Victoria in last hurrah before gang colours ban

image.altText: Ben Stokes shakes hands with Ravindra Jadeja

props.synopsis: The infamous spirit of cricket debate is back after a tense ending to the fourth Test between England and India. It is time to accept that it doesn't exist.

title.children: Stokes-India handshake drama suggests 'spirit of cricket' may be a myth

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: The airline has now received the green light from Food Standards Australia New Zealand, a major regulatory hurdle that stalled the rollout after Virgin first announced the plan last year.

title.children: Virgin Australia to allow pets on board before the end of the year

image.altText: Composite image of Shaboozey in a field wearing denim and a close up of Jelly Roll wearing a cap with tattoos on face.

props.synopsis: A new festival slated for later this year will feature massive international stars who have never toured Australia before.

title.children: Amid festival cancellations, one musical genre is bucking the trend

image.altText: A small wood heater with fire wood

props.synopsis: A new generation of low-emission wood heaters that produce a fraction of the particulate pollution of current models could save lives by improving air quality, researchers say.

title.children: Why Australia hasn't adopted NZ's solution to wood smoke pollution

image.altText: Smiling Cameron McEvoy points his finger after winning gold at the Paris Olympics, Omega written behind on pool wall.

props.synopsis: After more than a decade challenging at the top of the swimming world, Cameron McEvoy is chasing perfection in a most unforgiving race.

title.children: With no leeway in a 21-second race, Cam McEvoy is hunting perfection

image.altText: A painting of Indigenous musician William Barton in a living room, smiling brightly, holding a didgeridoo with one hand.

props.synopsis: Recovering from a painful injury, Loribelle Spirovski ditched her paintbrush to craft a portrait of William Barton. It just won People's Choice in the Archibald Prize.

title.children: Loribelle just won an art prize for a portrait she painted with her fingers

image.altText: Arrest picture in Barangaroo

props.synopsis: Two Sydney men have been charged with almost 200 offences following a major fraud operation into a scam where luxury cars, homes and businesses were obtained.

title.children: Bentleys, Ferrari among $38m in assets seized as alleged fraudsters charged

image.altText: A police car and police tape seen blocking the scene of a residential street in Wollert, where a shooting took place

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected targeted shooting after the discovery of a 21-year-old's body in Wollert. Separately, detectives have charged five men with murder over a fatal shooting almost two years ago.

title.children: Gunman at large after 21-year-old found dead in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A young woman dressed in medical scrubs looks tired on a couch.

props.synopsis: The government's pre-election pledge to cut student loans by 20 per cent proved incredibly popular with voters. But will it help to fix issues in the tertiary education system?

title.children: HECS debts are being cut by 20 per cent. Will it make university fairer?

image.altText: A man wearing a chequered shirt and helmet sitting on a motorbike looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The mother of teenage man, who died after he was hit by a car, says the bond she shared with her son was the most incredible thing she had in her entire life.

title.children: Friends, family pay tribute to beloved teen killed in crash

image.altText: A woman with a baby on her back with a rifle hanging on the wall in the background.

props.synopsis: Americans are being encouraged to have more children by the likes of Donald Trump, JD Vance and Elon Musk. And even though the risks for the poster families of pronatalism are real they are happy to bear them.

title.children: 'A worthwhile way to die': Inside America's pronatalist movement

image.altText: Ezra Mam of the Broncos catches the ball during the warm up

props.synopsis: Two powerful player agents are facing a potential suspension for their involvement in a physical altercation at a schoolboys competition last year.

title.children: Mam's agent among duo facing NRL ban over schoolboys altercation

image.altText: Daisy Pearce chats to Mikayla Western during a match

props.synopsis: West Coast coach Andrew McQualter says he will seek out advice from the club's AFLW coach, Daisy Pearce, to help turn the men's program around.

title.children: Eagles turn to AFLW coach Pearce to help resurrect men's program

image.altText: Laura Dahlmeier skiing in a biathlon event with mountains behind her.

props.synopsis: German biathlete Laura Dahlmeier has died, aged 31, after being hit by a rockfall while climbing in the mountains of Pakistan.

title.children: Olympic gold medallist dies in mountain climbing accident

image.altText: Nic White extends his right arm

props.synopsis: Australian scrum half Nic White will bring an end to his Test rugby career by starting in the number nine jersey for the Wallabies against the British and Irish Lions on Saturday.

title.children: White given starting spot in farewell Test against Lions

image.altText: A young boy with a hat and glasses texting on a phone

props.synopsis: Experts are encouraging parents to be alert around their children's use of generative AI, particularly chatbots and companion apps.

title.children: 'Not designed for children': What parents should know about AI chatbots

image.altText: Two students hold dusters to erase crosses on a board

props.synopsis: After 17 years of NAPLAN testing, Australia is yet to see a big turnaround in results — so what can be done to improve them?

title.children: 'Postcode, privilege' — not education system — shaping 'opportunity'

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has announced its third round of job cuts as it seeks to save $250 million, and the latest proposal "touches every part of the university".

title.children: 'Touches every part of the university': ANU to cut more jobs

image.altText: A dark van with a stripe on the bottom and a roof rack in dirt around bushland.

props.synopsis: After Carolina Wilga's miracle survival in West Australian bush, local farmers have worked together and braved rough terrain to recover her abandoned van.

title.children: Volunteers recover German backpacker's abandoned vehicle

image.altText: Man in suit wearing headset faces screen showing Jerome Powell

props.synopsis: The US president says the August 1 deadline for imposing higher "reciprocal" tariffs stands. Local stocks follow Wall Street lower after the US central bank left interest rates on hold. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Stocks fall as US rate cut hopes dashed and tariff deadline looms

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian shoe chain Wittner sold off after collapsing
Housing approval rebound still well short of government target, warns HIA
Treasurer assumes US tariff on Australia will remain 10pc

image.altText: People stand by the side of the road dressed in Black Sabbath tshirts.

props.synopsis: Fans of Black Sabbath frontman Ozzy Osbourne lined the streets of Birmingham in the UK to pay tribute to the late musician, while his wife Sharon was moved to tears as she laid flowers for her husband.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne fans line Birmingham streets to pay tribute ahead of funeral
